commit_message:
networking-odl: don't run liberty|mitaka job for different branch

There is no point to run liberty(or mitaka) job for
stable/mitaka(or stable/liberty) branch.
restrict job for stable branch to its corresponding branch.

subject: Add up-to-date check to oaktree-diskcheck job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 21:48:09.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/oaktree.yaml'], 'message': "Add up-to-date check to oaktree-diskcheck job

The generated go files need to be committed to the repo along with
changes to the proto files. (This isn't my first choice - but because of
the way library depends work in go it's the only thing that makes sense)

Because of that, every change to a proto file should cause the developer
to run make, produce the go changes and commit them along with the proto
changes. If the go files are up to date, running make in a git checkout
should not cause files to change.

Add a quick check to make sure people don't forget the go code. (I've
already done this once)

Change-Id: I50c6589f6b713c297d8827629ea13e6b68f72228
"}]
commit_message:
Add up-to-date check to oaktree-diskcheck job

The generated go files need to be committed to the repo along with
changes to the proto files. (This isn't my first choice - but because of
the way library depends work in go it's the only thing that makes sense)

Because of that, every change to a proto file should cause the developer
to run make, produce the go changes and commit them along with the proto
changes. If the go files are up to date, running make in a git checkout
should not cause files to change.

Add a quick check to make sure people don't forget the go code. (I've
already done this once)

Change-Id: I50c6589f6b713c297d8827629ea13e6b68f72228

subject: Fixes port security rules deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-08 16:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/security_groups_driver.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_security_groups_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fixes port security rules deletion

Port security rules might contain rules that apply
to any protocol.

Currently there is no checking to see if a rule
which will be deleted belongs to a security
rule that applies to all protocols.

This patch addresses this issue by adding a check
to make sure the rule can be safely removed.

Closes-Bug: #1634082
Change-Id: Icfa7d77609394a2a7030f68c2643baf309a5de74
(cherry picked from commit 02e2337ac7223f97d78812846defe345372b785e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes port security rules deletion

Port security rules might contain rules that apply
to any protocol.

Currently there is no checking to see if a rule
which will be deleted belongs to a security
rule that applies to all protocols.

This patch addresses this issue by adding a check
to make sure the rule can be safely removed.

Closes-Bug: #1634082
Change-Id: Icfa7d77609394a2a7030f68c2643baf309a5de74
(cherry picked from commit 02e2337ac7223f97d78812846defe345372b785e)

subject: install distro packages before running the announce script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 21:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'install distro packages before running the announce script

The swift client release [1] failed because there was a missing system
dependency. We were already installing the dependencies of the thing
being released, but not of the release tools themselves. This change
adds the extra step to ensure that the dependencies of the release tools
are available before they are run.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/8e/8e127421b7cf0c5fe19b0aae3bcc0fdd12c4c169/release/python-swiftclient-announce-release/d5aefbf/console.html

Change-Id: Iea5513fd7734e493d2e24ce3e8fb4b3887ef79ec
'}]
commit_message:
install distro packages before running the announce script

The swift client release [1] failed because there was a missing system
dependency. We were already installing the dependencies of the thing
being released, but not of the release tools themselves. This change
adds the extra step to ensure that the dependencies of the release tools
are available before they are run.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/8e/8e127421b7cf0c5fe19b0aae3bcc0fdd12c4c169/release/python-swiftclient-announce-release/d5aefbf/console.html

Change-Id: Iea5513fd7734e493d2e24ce3e8fb4b3887ef79ec

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I82387fec7ac94001a6c2379321ebf1f2e3f40c12

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-15 07:23:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/openstack-macros/macros.openstack-rdo', 'openstack/openstack-macros/openstack-macros.spec.j2', 'openstack/openstack-macros/macros.openstack-suse'], 'message': 'Added tempest plugin entrypoint macro

* This macro will creates a fake tempest plugin
  entrypoint under %{python2_sitelib}/%{service}_tests.egg-info.

* The generated %{python2_sitelib}/%{service}_tests.egg-info
  will go under %files section of tempest plugin subpackage

* It will required for subpackaging of current in-tree tempest plugins.
  For example: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/3524/

* Added dummy implementation for suse

Change-Id: Iffcb3872140b8242812158cd0fca88bcbc69c7c7
'}]
commit_message:
Added tempest plugin entrypoint macro

* This macro will creates a fake tempest plugin
  entrypoint under %{python2_sitelib}/%{service}_tests.egg-info.

* The generated %{python2_sitelib}/%{service}_tests.egg-info
  will go under %files section of tempest plugin subpackage

* It will required for subpackaging of current in-tree tempest plugins.
  For example: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/3524/

* Added dummy implementation for suse

Change-Id: Iffcb3872140b8242812158cd0fca88bcbc69c7c7

If we don't close connection to ceph cluster,
The connection count increases with cinder bakcup until exceed max open files.
Then rise OSError: [Errno 24] Too many open files

This patch is to close connection to ceph cluster after cinder backup.

Change-Id: I2fb243d2a57771dc3589e96db54e998e2c1c8ef7
Closes-bug: #1628626
"}]
commit_message:
Close connection to ceph after cinder bakcup

If we don't close connection to ceph cluster,
The connection count increases with cinder bakcup until exceed max open files.
Then rise OSError: [Errno 24] Too many open files

This patch is to close connection to ceph cluster after cinder backup.

Change-Id: I2fb243d2a57771dc3589e96db54e998e2c1c8ef7
Closes-bug: #1628626

commit_message:
Introduce TripleO scenario004

This is meant to run newer services that are not available in
releases older than Ocata such as Barbican.

So, for instance, Barbican was moved from scenario002 (where it no
longer runs) to scenario004). Also, move Mistral and Zaqar, as these
either haven't landed or landed in Ocata.

Change-Id: I929a2345e817b2b198d26fafaa283a6fbffe3fe9
Depends-On: I19ed2dddd88ae1752c6b7500c1790f801f6bfcd9

commit_message:
Fix import of common libraries from troveclient

Troveclient removed the copy of oslo inclubated code (following a
global goal for Ocata) and this lead to some changes post-Newton.
As soon as a new troveclient release is created, Heat will fail to
import it.

See https://review.openstack.org/396267 for details on the troveclient
change.

Change-Id: I27e06ea4125e1fdd766673a578d2baf5a0a15a44

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-14 23:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_security_group.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/security_group.py'], 'message': "Add uuid field to SecurityGroup object

We're going to store requested security group objects in the
request spec. nova-network security groups are unique by name
and tenant. Neutron security groups, however, are not unique
by name within a tenant, they are unique by uuid. So to uniquely
store the requested security groups in the request spec we need
to store the neutron-specific id value (which is a uuid) in the
SecurityGroup.uuid field added here.

Since we don't store this in the nova database the uuid value
must be popped during a save() and ignored when creating an
object from a DB primitive.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I3c3fb8fe9a53155caba49b353c0524f84dc458ff
"}]
commit_message:
Add uuid field to SecurityGroup object

We're going to store requested security group objects in the
request spec. nova-network security groups are unique by name
and tenant. Neutron security groups, however, are not unique
by name within a tenant, they are unique by uuid. So to uniquely
store the requested security groups in the request spec we need
to store the neutron-specific id value (which is a uuid) in the
SecurityGroup.uuid field added here.

Since we don't store this in the nova database the uuid value
must be popped during a save() and ignored when creating an
object from a DB primitive.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I3c3fb8fe9a53155caba49b353c0524f84dc458ff

commit_message:
Handle test subpackage for manila in %install

Previously, the %openstack_test_package_install macro was used inside
the %build block, and the generated directory was removed as a first
step for %install, so the rpmbuild process failed to find any files
for the test subpackage.

Change-Id: Iad76ab24907c3cf3ce4bb279d90b12b37a6d34e5
(cherry picked from commit 0c6145c6c408dadb794f84f25e1fe5bd28f9419d)

commit_message:
Delete duplicated dvr tests

DvrRoutersTest tempest/api/network/test_routers.py
looks like a less commented version of the one in the
tempest/api/network/admin/test_routers_dvr.py .

The tests requires admin user,
so removing the DvrRoutersTest from the non-admin location.

The tempest/api/network/test_routers.py had an extra assert,
which is moved to tempest/api/network/admin/test_routers_dvr.py .

The two test classes looks so similar, so I suspected we duplicated it
by an internal tempest code move, but not, it was submitted separately.

Change-Id: I75c5ec4050235c79e6269ace6862be054d032821

commit_message:
Raise exception if delete disabled terminate server

When we try to delete an instance which is disabled to terminate, the
response is ok without any error info in current version, but in fact
does nothing work, it's very unfriendly and easy to confuse user.
It may be better to raise an exception that can be caught by client.
After fix this bug, when we try to delete a server which is disabled
to terminate, we will get `Instance 5a7b14b0-a47c-47be-98bb-92e139d16b00
is disabled terminate (HTTP 409)` exception.

Change-Id: I4b71fb808d82cd9c11b8b4e1ef6f20f8588d7b8d
Closes-Bug: #1640709

commit_message:
Fix the ansible version requirement in different stable branch.

Manage disable_password_reveal

A user can disable the password reveal button in the horizon UI via the
configuration. This change adds the ability to toggle this to True via
the puppet modules.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 16:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': "wsgi: headers is an array

The keystone vhost contains 'Header undef' which is incorrect.
This is because undef will go throught the apache
puppet module directly to a template that except an array or false:

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/templates/vhost/_header.erb

Change-Id: Iae46695a3d9af6743695506c416b7d41cf6de309
"}]
commit_message:
wsgi: headers is an array

The keystone vhost contains 'Header undef' which is incorrect.
This is because undef will go throught the apache
puppet module directly to a template that except an array or false:

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/templates/vhost/_header.erb

Change-Id: Iae46695a3d9af6743695506c416b7d41cf6de309

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 08:10:09.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/plugin/crypto/simple_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/util/test_multiple_backends.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_secret_store.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/manager.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/store_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/plugin/crypto/base.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_store_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/crypto/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Rename crypto.py to base.py

On case non-case sensitive file systems (used in OSX or
Windows) the import of "Crypto" leads to an import of
the local crypto.py. This leads to very strange errors
during unit test runs.

Change-Id: I03e61789a9eb98036600ecf6f86f0dad2eb7621c
Closes-bug: #1602936
'}]
commit_message:
Rename crypto.py to base.py

On case non-case sensitive file systems (used in OSX or
Windows) the import of "Crypto" leads to an import of
the local crypto.py. This leads to very strange errors
during unit test runs.

Change-Id: I03e61789a9eb98036600ecf6f86f0dad2eb7621c
Closes-bug: #1602936

commit_message:
Handle test subpackage for manila in %install

Previously, the %openstack_test_package_install macro was used inside
the %build block, and the generated directory was removed as a first
step for %install, so the rpmbuild process failed to find any files
for the test subpackage.

Change-Id: Iad76ab24907c3cf3ce4bb279d90b12b37a6d34e5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-14 22:05:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Only mark ports ready on synced networks

The DHCP agent was previously resending every single port to
the server whenever sync_state was called, even if it was just
for one network.

This let to sending way too much unnecessary data to the server
and also potentially resulted in sending a port to the server
that wasn't actually provisioned yet.

This patch corrects the behavior by only sending ports for networks
that are being synced if it's a conditional sync.

Closes-Bug: #1639086
Change-Id: Ie7686837b18ff251baa315ef95dc511cda475672
(cherry picked from commit 7dc2707c2b0b05ad7699a24680a5b45e67f717fc)
"}]
commit_message:
Only mark ports ready on synced networks

The DHCP agent was previously resending every single port to
the server whenever sync_state was called, even if it was just
for one network.

This let to sending way too much unnecessary data to the server
and also potentially resulted in sending a port to the server
that wasn't actually provisioned yet.

This patch corrects the behavior by only sending ports for networks
that are being synced if it's a conditional sync.

Closes-Bug: #1639086
Change-Id: Ie7686837b18ff251baa315ef95dc511cda475672
(cherry picked from commit 7dc2707c2b0b05ad7699a24680a5b45e67f717fc)

subject: DHCP: Add missing path for marking ports as ready
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 22:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': "DHCP: Add missing path for marking ports as ready

'refresh_dhcp_helper', which is called after subnet update/create
notifications in the DHCP agent, can end up retrieving ports that
the agent hadn't yet seen. It will then configure those ports but
not notify the server that they are ready.

Unless the port is subsequently updated on the server afterwards to
generate a new port update notification, the DHCP agent won't ever tell
the server that the port has had DHCP provisioned. This led to the
bug this closes. Another patch[1] that removed excessive DHCP ready
notifications uncovered this bug.

This patch just adjusts refresh_dhcp_helper to ensure that all ports
are marked as ready after configuring them all.

1. Ie7686837b18ff251baa315ef95dc511cda475672

Change-Id: I1fed60c1835c2ebed7c050c6fa114f89beec3190
Closes-Bug: #1639806
(cherry picked from commit 9f1057bfd9aff4acee1d41f14298c155a6759f55)
"}]
commit_message:
DHCP: Add missing path for marking ports as ready

'refresh_dhcp_helper', which is called after subnet update/create
notifications in the DHCP agent, can end up retrieving ports that
the agent hadn't yet seen. It will then configure those ports but
not notify the server that they are ready.

Unless the port is subsequently updated on the server afterwards to
generate a new port update notification, the DHCP agent won't ever tell
the server that the port has had DHCP provisioned. This led to the
bug this closes. Another patch[1] that removed excessive DHCP ready
notifications uncovered this bug.

This patch just adjusts refresh_dhcp_helper to ensure that all ports
are marked as ready after configuring them all.

1. Ie7686837b18ff251baa315ef95dc511cda475672

Change-Id: I1fed60c1835c2ebed7c050c6fa114f89beec3190
Closes-Bug: #1639806
(cherry picked from commit 9f1057bfd9aff4acee1d41f14298c155a6759f55)

commit_message:
Enforce policy before resource.validate

We make client calls in resource.validate for number of
resource plugins to check constraints or custom validations.
However, we're enforcing resource policies after validate
that results in unnecessary client calls and 'unauthorized'
errors from the service.

Change-Id: I37c22027115beded4ea9585729a97882c961fad0
Closes-Bug: #1627706

commit_message:
Allow skipping floating IP checks.

Currently OVN based deployments to do not support floating IPs. Provide
a network-feature-enabled switch to disable running these tests.

Change-Id: I799c557b239f1102e67b8c67810e42a864a490f2

subject: Updates to API report tooling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 16:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pyir.py', 'tools/api_report.sh'], 'message': "Updates to API report tooling

This patch updates our api-report tooling as follows:
- Bugfix to support None as a valid public API attribute value.
- Rather than tracking collections with scalars, the tool now just
tracks the type of the collection (e.g. dict, list, etc.). There's no
reason for this tool to dig into collections and track their values
for API (tho it could do more with additional effort/code).
- Better handling/output for API signature changes. Previously
some of the output describing a changed API was a bit confusing.
This patch tries to address that issue by adding additional handling
for the scenario.

Sample output from current report [1] vs output with this patch [2].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587662/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587663/

Change-Id: Ic380633477c9939773198463a21ef887d575aa21
"}]
commit_message:
Updates to API report tooling

This patch updates our api-report tooling as follows:
- Bugfix to support None as a valid public API attribute value.
- Rather than tracking collections with scalars, the tool now just
tracks the type of the collection (e.g. dict, list, etc.). There's no
reason for this tool to dig into collections and track their values
for API (tho it could do more with additional effort/code).
- Better handling/output for API signature changes. Previously
some of the output describing a changed API was a bit confusing.
This patch tries to address that issue by adding additional handling
for the scenario.

Sample output from current report [1] vs output with this patch [2].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587662/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587663/

Change-Id: Ic380633477c9939773198463a21ef887d575aa21

commit_message:
move old apiclient code out of openstack/common

As part of the first community-wide goal [1], teams were asked
to remove the openstack/common package of their projects
if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator
form of syncing common functionality.

The package, apiclient, was moved to a top level location
and cliutils was moved to the common module. There are no oslo
specific libraries, the recommended solution is to move it
in tree and maintain it there.

[1] http://governance.openstack.org/goals/ocata/remove-incubated-oslo-code.html

Change-Id: If28f22e5ff6002bef8d9dfc27a694d1100535dc9

commit_message:
use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of py3kcompat

as part of the openstack wide ocata goal, all references to the
now obsolete oslo-incubator modules (in openstack/common) should
be removed. this is the first step in doing that, a future patch
will move the apiclient to be a top level module.

Change-Id: I0bcd01b3f6ff6c7e562bd9419c6a8e86989b1e27

Change-Id: I95c13fe23f789ac5c7eff41cc99eeea3cb362a99

commit_message:
Engine support for profile-list2

This patch adds support to profile list v2 in engine service layer.

subject: Fix removes date_time items from dictionaries
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-12 22:19:02.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/tests/functional/cli/test_murano.py'], 'message': "Fix removes date_time items from dictionaries

Some functional tests fail because they assert dictionaries
with date/time items. For example, test_environment_template_create
checks that dictionary env_template exists in env_template_list
dicrionary list. All mentioned dictionaries have date/time items
with keys 'Created' and 'Updated'. If the system, where functional
tests are executed will be quite slow - time in these dictionaries
could differ. This behavior will result corresponding test to fail
even if all tasks will be executed successfully because time in
dictionaries for 'Created' and 'Updated' keys will differ and
assert will fail

Removing the date/time items from dictionaries will help to
successfully pass functional tests

Related-Bug: #1626733

Change-Id: Ibb85992e8b3869ae2b7adf58f8b4f9b134d07139
"}]
commit_message:
Fix removes date_time items from dictionaries

Some functional tests fail because they assert dictionaries
with date/time items. For example, test_environment_template_create
checks that dictionary env_template exists in env_template_list
dicrionary list. All mentioned dictionaries have date/time items
with keys 'Created' and 'Updated'. If the system, where functional
tests are executed will be quite slow - time in these dictionaries
could differ. This behavior will result corresponding test to fail
even if all tasks will be executed successfully because time in
dictionaries for 'Created' and 'Updated' keys will differ and
assert will fail

Removing the date/time items from dictionaries will help to
successfully pass functional tests

Related-Bug: #1626733

Change-Id: Ibb85992e8b3869ae2b7adf58f8b4f9b134d07139

commit_message:
Support both x-openstack-request-id and x-compute-request-id for Nova

Trying to adopt RequestId middleware from oslo_middleware in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358375/

We should support both x-openstack-request-id and
x-compute-request-id in
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_instance_actions.py#n32
first and move to only support x-openstack-request-id once the
Nova patch have been merged.

Closes-bug: #1618572

commit_message:
Replace compute_req_id middlware by RequestId oslo middleware

The middleware RequestId from oslo middleware can totally
replace compute_req_id middleware in nova, there is no
reason to still have it.

Change-Id: I7de52ebf5fd7c411bc9cfba0b02140c1a9b40d43
Closes-bug: #1615456
Depends-On: Ib7bb25c53c6c579c2eaf305bf87866b1fcc42e02

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-12 07:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/server-groups-notification.rst'], 'message': 'Add notifications for server groups

Currently, no notification will be sent
for server groups changes, so it is not
possible for external system to get
notifications when there are server groups
created, updated or deleted.

Having such notifications help external
system to get the up to date server
groups data and metrics.

This spec is proposed to nova to send out
notifications when:

- new SeverGroup is created
- ServerGroup is deleted
- new servers added to the ServerGroup
- server has been deleted from the ServerGroup

Change-Id: Ibe7bbd323fd8a87239168825c5bdde4301edb3c3
blueprint: add-notification-for-server-groups
'}]
commit_message:
Add notifications for server groups

Currently, no notification will be sent
for server groups changes, so it is not
possible for external system to get
notifications when there are server groups
created, updated or deleted.

Having such notifications help external
system to get the up to date server
groups data and metrics.

This spec is proposed to nova to send out
notifications when:

- new SeverGroup is created
- ServerGroup is deleted
- new servers added to the ServerGroup
- server has been deleted from the ServerGroup

Change-Id: Ibe7bbd323fd8a87239168825c5bdde4301edb3c3
blueprint: add-notification-for-server-groups

subject: Revert "Display neutron api error message more precisely"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 09:35:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/session.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/network/v2/test_router.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Display neutron api error message more precisely"

This reverts commit 23f4aa883244098f121c244e897c417410a8544f.

This patch is problematic, it is breaking cases that are not Neutron related. The problem is that when there are HttpError thrown, we cannot guarantee that the body contains a valid JSON, the .response.json line is wrong. Need to rework it.

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Display neutron api error message more precisely"

This reverts commit 23f4aa883244098f121c244e897c417410a8544f.

This patch is problematic, it is breaking cases that are not Neutron related. The problem is that when there are HttpError thrown, we cannot guarantee that the body contains a valid JSON, the .response.json line is wrong. Need to rework it.

Change-Id: Ie513c0869bb253680dfe3a08b1c5f09c2d4783a5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 21:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Instance obj_clone leaves metadata as changed

When performing an obj_clone on an Instance object, it relies on the
base obj_clone's deep copy method which just goes through all of the
fields and duplicates them on the clone.  However, the Instance object
has internal tracking attributes for metadata and system_metadata that
keep track of which keys have changed.  Since these don't get copied
over on the deep copy, these will show up as having changed on the
cloned Instance (if they had metadata set originally) and on a save
on this cloned object will end up updating the metadata in the db
which if these have stale information will wipe out other changes.

Such a scenario to this is occurring during build_instance where the
Claim constructor is saving off a clone of the Instance object
so that it will have the current copy.  In the case of a failure
during the build_instance, the claim will use this current copy
to then set the value of the host on the instance to None.  Since
the clone reflects that the system_metadata has changed, it will
as part of the save try to update the system_metadata in the db,
which since it is stale will wipe out changes made.

In the case of the issue being fixed here, the value in the
system_metdata being wiped out is the network_allocated=True
attribute.  By this being wiped out then reschedules of that
build_instance fail in cases where the IP address has been
assigned to the instance.

Change-Id: Ie49a90993fb9643c04d75402dbaaa933c6b5222e
Closes-Bug: #1639230
(cherry picked from commit 9345ed40e85e291d2f9e9aac24d468f40140ae0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Instance obj_clone leaves metadata as changed

When performing an obj_clone on an Instance object, it relies on the
base obj_clone's deep copy method which just goes through all of the
fields and duplicates them on the clone.  However, the Instance object
has internal tracking attributes for metadata and system_metadata that
keep track of which keys have changed.  Since these don't get copied
over on the deep copy, these will show up as having changed on the
cloned Instance (if they had metadata set originally) and on a save
on this cloned object will end up updating the metadata in the db
which if these have stale information will wipe out other changes.

Such a scenario to this is occurring during build_instance where the
Claim constructor is saving off a clone of the Instance object
so that it will have the current copy.  In the case of a failure
during the build_instance, the claim will use this current copy
to then set the value of the host on the instance to None.  Since
the clone reflects that the system_metadata has changed, it will
as part of the save try to update the system_metadata in the db,
which since it is stale will wipe out changes made.

In the case of the issue being fixed here, the value in the
system_metdata being wiped out is the network_allocated=True
attribute.  By this being wiped out then reschedules of that
build_instance fail in cases where the IP address has been
assigned to the instance.

Change-Id: Ie49a90993fb9643c04d75402dbaaa933c6b5222e
Closes-Bug: #1639230
(cherry picked from commit 9345ed40e85e291d2f9e9aac24d468f40140ae0e)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 12:08:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/network/model.py'], 'message': "Add a no-op wait method to NetworkInfo

The normal deploy flow uses a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper for network
allocation, and because of that many places have to call that class's
wait method to make sure it has completed. During a reschedule where
the network was allocated by a previous build attempt, a NetworkInfo
instance is retrieved instead, which does not have a wait method. This
then results in an exception complaining the missing method when it is
called. This fix addresses that by adding a no-op wait method to the
NetworkInfo class. Alternatively could have used isinstance or hasattr
to avoid making wait calls on NetworkInfo, but that could be
problematic to maintain as more places need to make wait calls in the
future and may not know to make the isinstance/hasattr check.

This fixes a regression issue caused by
61fc1b9ee11e416aecbf3a29e1d150a53fc890e8 ,
which reverted the previous fix made under
24a04c405ab2c98e52ea1edf8775489907526c6d

Change-Id: Id7a71b2eb46ea7df19e7da0afbc0eafa87cac965
Closes-Bug: 1636109
(cherry picked from commit 1b351ef5356e0472aef51221ff02376dd8b42954)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a no-op wait method to NetworkInfo

The normal deploy flow uses a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper for network
allocation, and because of that many places have to call that class's
wait method to make sure it has completed. During a reschedule where
the network was allocated by a previous build attempt, a NetworkInfo
instance is retrieved instead, which does not have a wait method. This
then results in an exception complaining the missing method when it is
called. This fix addresses that by adding a no-op wait method to the
NetworkInfo class. Alternatively could have used isinstance or hasattr
to avoid making wait calls on NetworkInfo, but that could be
problematic to maintain as more places need to make wait calls in the
future and may not know to make the isinstance/hasattr check.

This fixes a regression issue caused by
61fc1b9ee11e416aecbf3a29e1d150a53fc890e8 ,
which reverted the previous fix made under
24a04c405ab2c98e52ea1edf8775489907526c6d

Change-Id: Id7a71b2eb46ea7df19e7da0afbc0eafa87cac965
Closes-Bug: 1636109
(cherry picked from commit 1b351ef5356e0472aef51221ff02376dd8b42954)

commit_message:
Add option to specify IPA version

The current DIB element uses IPA from master with no option to configure
the refs. This change adds an environment export into the source
repository which provides the deployer the ability to configure deploy
images to use specific versions of IPA.

Change-Id: I0f08e8af3b576178c76078f6b070ead9e0cc90fe
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

for fedora/rhel/centos the main supported ARCH is x86_64. This patch allow

commit_message:
simplify ARCH param for rhel/centos param can be x86_64 and amd64

for fedora/rhel/centos the main supported ARCH is x86_64. This patch allow
to call diskimage-builder with the above distro's with param ARCH=x86_64,
And also retain same behaiver when call with ARCH=amd64 as it translate
anyway to x86_64. Doing so wil simplify user expirience.

Change-Id: I229e0912434109b1b48a030bd35ad8dc1096a629

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 03:51:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/credential/backends/base.py'], 'message': "Clean up the code for credential deletion

Keystone credential only has one backend, the logic of credentials
deletion for project or user in SQL backend has been implemented
and overridden the code in base, which means the default implementation
in base will never been called.

And it's unnecessarily call DB API twice to fulfill the function
compared the implementation in SQL backend.

code in SQL backend is here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/credential/backends/sql.py#L93-L103

Change-Id: Ib192e1d163a28c86fee102614e508c6231eba259
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up the code for credential deletion

Keystone credential only has one backend, the logic of credentials
deletion for project or user in SQL backend has been implemented
and overridden the code in base, which means the default implementation
in base will never been called.

And it's unnecessarily call DB API twice to fulfill the function
compared the implementation in SQL backend.

code in SQL backend is here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/credential/backends/sql.py#L93-L103

Change-Id: Ib192e1d163a28c86fee102614e508c6231eba259

subject: yum_install: fix awk return code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 05:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'yum_install: fix awk return code

TIL:

  Similarly, all the END rules are merged, and executed when all the
  input is exhausted (or when an exit statement is executed).

i.e. matching YUM_FAILED calls "exit", which falls through to the END
rules which calls "exit result" ... which is zero.  i.e. if the return
code is 1 then we actually hide that and return with zero.

This is rather annoying because errors that should halt to alert us of
a package install failure pass through, only for you to have to debug
much later on seemingly unrelated problems.

This always sets "result" and thus should be returning the right
thing.  I've updated the documentation to hopefully make it clearer
what's going on.

Change-Id: Ia15b7dc55efb8d3e3e945241b67a468b8a914672
'}]
commit_message:
yum_install: fix awk return code

TIL:

  Similarly, all the END rules are merged, and executed when all the
  input is exhausted (or when an exit statement is executed).

i.e. matching YUM_FAILED calls "exit", which falls through to the END
rules which calls "exit result" ... which is zero.  i.e. if the return
code is 1 then we actually hide that and return with zero.

This is rather annoying because errors that should halt to alert us of
a package install failure pass through, only for you to have to debug
much later on seemingly unrelated problems.

This always sets "result" and thus should be returning the right
thing.  I've updated the documentation to hopefully make it clearer
what's going on.

Change-Id: Ia15b7dc55efb8d3e3e945241b67a468b8a914672

subject: Be specific about protected being bool
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-14 19:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Be specific about protected being bool

Protected needs to be bool - but other values need to get cast to
string. There's no good way other than enumerating them like we did for
the other values.

There are two ways to pass in user-defined settings - via the meta param
which does not get cast to anything else and assumes the values are in
the correct type, and **kwargs which does its best to cast.

We know about protected. We can add others if needed (although the
glance docs do not list any other boolean values)

Change-Id: Ib75246441e54d675987a18b890ce847043e7a80f
"}]
commit_message:
Be specific about protected being bool

Protected needs to be bool - but other values need to get cast to
string. There's no good way other than enumerating them like we did for
the other values.

There are two ways to pass in user-defined settings - via the meta param
which does not get cast to anything else and assumes the values are in
the correct type, and **kwargs which does its best to cast.

We know about protected. We can add others if needed (although the
glance docs do not list any other boolean values)

Change-Id: Ib75246441e54d675987a18b890ce847043e7a80f

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-11 15:21:55.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_util_node.py', 'octane/util/node.py', 'octane/magic_consts.py', 'octane/handlers/upgrade/controller.py'], 'message': 'Stopping the neutron l3 agent before controller upgrade procedure

Graceful shutdown of l3 agent with migration of routers
served by it allows to minimize network disruption for
tenant VMs during the upgrade procedure.

Otherwise the abnormal shutdown of l3 agent causes routers
to be unavailable for 10s of minutes upon upgrade of the
first controller from the environment.

Change-Id: I1360bba260ffc4b16565a3d97cfa708bbf6bcdec
Closes-Bug: #1543972
'}]
commit_message:
Stopping the neutron l3 agent before controller upgrade procedure

Graceful shutdown of l3 agent with migration of routers
served by it allows to minimize network disruption for
tenant VMs during the upgrade procedure.

Otherwise the abnormal shutdown of l3 agent causes routers
to be unavailable for 10s of minutes upon upgrade of the
first controller from the environment.

Change-Id: I1360bba260ffc4b16565a3d97cfa708bbf6bcdec
Closes-Bug: #1543972

commit_message:
Remove @test.services('network') from testcases

Some testcases uses @test.services('network'), but service network
is always True in get_service_list in test.py, so there is no need
to use this decorator for service network. This is to remove it.

Change-Id: I00bddedcd62ca0f90b351b9652e640f932017ac4

As part of the first community-wide goal [1], teams were asked
to remove the openstack/common package of their projects
if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator
form of syncing common functionality.

The package, apiclient, was moved to a top level location
and cliutils was moved to the common module. There are no oslo
specific libraries, the recommended solution is to move it
in tree and maintain it there.

Specifically in this patch, I also rearranged some of the
imports to make them match up with the hacking guidelines
while I was re-ordering them for the refactor anyway.

Lastly, the apiclient/fake_client.py was deleted since it
was not used.

[1] http://governance.openstack.org/goals/ocata/remove-incubated-oslo-code.html

Change-Id: Ib7b691240b819c9c91b100ca47ffaba75b281c78

commit_message:
move old apiclient code out of openstack/common

As part of the first community-wide goal [1], teams were asked
to remove the openstack/common package of their projects
if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator
form of syncing common functionality.

The package, apiclient, was moved to a top level location
and cliutils was moved to the common module. There are no oslo
specific libraries, the recommended solution is to move it
in tree and maintain it there.

Specifically in this patch, I also rearranged some of the
imports to make them match up with the hacking guidelines
while I was re-ordering them for the refactor anyway.

Lastly, the apiclient/fake_client.py was deleted since it
was not used.

[1] http://governance.openstack.org/goals/ocata/remove-incubated-oslo-code.html

Change-Id: Ib7b691240b819c9c91b100ca47ffaba75b281c78

subject: Remove pointless and fragile unittest
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 19:34:55.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_inventory.py'], 'message': "Remove pointless and fragile unittest

There is a change in OCC that does some weird things for unittests. It's
not a production issue. However, this pointless test doesn't mock out
things it _should_, so it breaks with incomplete auth information.
Removing it makes the world a better place.

Change-Id: I919c62b6de05f9fe92a5cdb7c3fa77ffd40d5cfc
"}]
commit_message:
Remove pointless and fragile unittest

There is a change in OCC that does some weird things for unittests. It's
not a production issue. However, this pointless test doesn't mock out
things it _should_, so it breaks with incomplete auth information.
Removing it makes the world a better place.

Change-Id: I919c62b6de05f9fe92a5cdb7c3fa77ffd40d5cfc

commit_message:
Update package metadata.

In order to move forward with constraints support it's beneficial to have
the openstack_requirements tools installable from pypi.

The change:
 * Adds MacOS as a supported platform
 * Add python 3,5 as a supported language
 * Updates the package name to remove the old openstack namespace

Change-Id: Ifdb2428d59fd3cd47f36a72487328e6c5520ebea

subject: Move dib-run-parts into diskimage-builder
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-04 06:08:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user_guide/installation.rst', 'diskimage_builder/dib_run_parts.py', 'requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-dib-utils-37f70dfad54900a0.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/lib/dib-run-parts', 'diskimage_builder/elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/90-base-dib-run-parts', 'setup.cfg', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': 'Move dib-run-parts into diskimage-builder

Move dib-run-parts from dib-utils into diskimage-builder directly.

For calling outside the chroot, we provide a standard entry-point
script.  However, as noted in the warning comment, the underlying
script is still copied directly into the chroot by the dib-run-parts
element.  I believe this to be the KISS approach.

This removes the dependency on dib-utils.  We have discussed this
previously and nobody seemed to think retiring dib-utils was going to
be an issue.

This also updates the documentation to not mention dib-utils, or using
disk-image-create via $PATH setup, but rather gives instructions on
installing from pip with a virtualenv.

Change-Id: Ic1e22ba498d2c368da7d72e2e2b70ff34324feb8
'}]
commit_message:
Move dib-run-parts into diskimage-builder

Move dib-run-parts from dib-utils into diskimage-builder directly.

For calling outside the chroot, we provide a standard entry-point
script.  However, as noted in the warning comment, the underlying
script is still copied directly into the chroot by the dib-run-parts
element.  I believe this to be the KISS approach.

This removes the dependency on dib-utils.  We have discussed this
previously and nobody seemed to think retiring dib-utils was going to
be an issue.

This also updates the documentation to not mention dib-utils, or using
disk-image-create via $PATH setup, but rather gives instructions on
installing from pip with a virtualenv.

Change-Id: Ic1e22ba498d2c368da7d72e2e2b70ff34324feb8

commit_message:
Fix Designate dashboard wheel name

Designate Dashboard is packaged as 'designatedashboard', which
does not match the git repo format of "designate-dashboard". So we
have to manually specify to py_pkgs what the name of the wheel should
be.

Change-Id: I644208968ffea61b54b17df0fb0fb681307ab7eb

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 09:12:06.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_eni.py', 'os_net_config/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#31>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#32>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I8b8b47de26b9bf688d9d27a4daa6d9910994ac4a
Closes-Bug: #1339855
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#31>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#32>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I8b8b47de26b9bf688d9d27a4daa6d9910994ac4a
Closes-Bug: #1339855

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-14 15:13:50.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Make version of tempest configurable

This patch makes tempest version configurable so we can override
it in CI for DLRN promotion jobs for stable branches.

There have been some backwards incompatible changes in tempest
and ceilometer ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395506/ ) not
tagged yet in stable/newton. In order to get p-o-i pass with this
commits we need to use an updated version of tempest.

Change-Id: Ifb37a5a3a809c8a94d055d9cdc2b880e1ec9a115
(cherry picked from commit e7bd64b10839e5fcad130e7939a39ba922623669)
'}]
commit_message:
Make version of tempest configurable

This patch makes tempest version configurable so we can override
it in CI for DLRN promotion jobs for stable branches.

There have been some backwards incompatible changes in tempest
and ceilometer ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395506/ ) not
tagged yet in stable/newton. In order to get p-o-i pass with this
commits we need to use an updated version of tempest.

Change-Id: Ifb37a5a3a809c8a94d055d9cdc2b880e1ec9a115
(cherry picked from commit e7bd64b10839e5fcad130e7939a39ba922623669)

commit_message:
Fix resource type miss in vnfd scale template

For vnf scaling, the policy type which is defined in
tacker_def.yaml is 'tosca.policies.tacker.Scaling'.
So all the scaling policy should use this type.
Currently there are some typos when using this policy type.

Change-Id: I8f60c1712007756bb8b6650e053e0d7069f0f9ba
Closes-Bug: #1637895

commit_message:
Make version of tempest configurable

This patch makes tempest version configurable so we can override
it in CI for DLRN promotion jobs for stable branches.

There have been some backwards incompatible changes in tempest
and ceilometer ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395506/ ) not
tagged yet in stable/newton. In order to get p-o-i pass with this
commits we need to use an updated version of tempest.

Change-Id: Ifb37a5a3a809c8a94d055d9cdc2b880e1ec9a115

commit_message:
Basic listener scenario test

This migrates the test_listener_basic scenario test from neutron-lbaas.
This removes the test_load_balancer_basic test, which is made redundant
by this new test. This also represents a significant reworking of
several scenario test base methods, making them more useful for re-use,
and fixing several bugs.

Change-Id: Ia5f76269c56cc7ccf82095e01c26699405a96b7e
Co-Authored-By: Paul Glass <paul.glass@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Balukoff <stephen@balukoff.com>

commit_message:
Dell SC: Live Volumes not cleaned up

When a volume is deleted after failover/failback some
live volumes might not be found and could be orphaned.

Change-Id: If28cf815f8c9b0ad02bf5a58c97c265da35dcf98
Closes-Bug: #1632069

commit_message:
Fixed user in group participance

When a group has an assignment instead of user,
Keystone should use proper attribute while searching in
groups DN in LDAP. Originaly DN is hardcoded.

Closes-bug: #1526462

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-30 21:13:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v2.py', 'keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/models/revoke_model.py', 'keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/revoke/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_os_revoke.py', 'keystone/revoke/core.py', 'etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_revoke.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': 'WIP Remove unneeded revocation events

REBASING: Still broken

Instad of revoking upon Project deactivat ion and so on
this does a live check upon token validation.

Some of the role apis are a little more forgiving.

If a user loses a role, it is ipoosible that the token will
still validate, just with a lesser set of roles.  However,
if the role removed is the last role, the tokek will still
be invalid.

Trustee pass word change no longer invalidates a token. It
never should have, as the Trustee is not involved during
trust execution.

Change-Id: I0fde221ace0006e4a5e306881447c6345a2ae8df
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Remove unneeded revocation events

REBASING: Still broken

Instad of revoking upon Project deactivat ion and so on
this does a live check upon token validation.

Some of the role apis are a little more forgiving.

If a user loses a role, it is ipoosible that the token will
still validate, just with a lesser set of roles.  However,
if the role removed is the last role, the tokek will still
be invalid.

Trustee pass word change no longer invalidates a token. It
never should have, as the Trustee is not involved during
trust execution.

Change-Id: I0fde221ace0006e4a5e306881447c6345a2ae8df

commit_message:
Show openstack_version instance of version on releases page

There is no simple way to update version number
correctly from 9.0 to 9.1 everywhere. So let's
just hide '9.0' part of release versions.

blueprint: dont-show-9-0-version

Change-Id: I068844e766610fe66fe83c0a000efb668eaffb62

subject: Refactor checking of immutable fields update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-21 01:06:17.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py', 'keystone/resource/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Refactor checking of immutable fields update

Refactors the checking of immutable fields (is_domain and parent_id) in
keystone update_project in order to ease the adding of new immutable
fields (as domain_id is supposed to be in the future) and avoid
code repetition. It also fixes tests that expected update of parent_id
to raise a ForbiddenAction, when the correct exception is a
ValidationError.

Change-Id: I9fb0583c156dd2765a31f71d14c10988722b9537
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor checking of immutable fields update

Refactors the checking of immutable fields (is_domain and parent_id) in
keystone update_project in order to ease the adding of new immutable
fields (as domain_id is supposed to be in the future) and avoid
code repetition. It also fixes tests that expected update of parent_id
to raise a ForbiddenAction, when the correct exception is a
ValidationError.

Change-Id: I9fb0583c156dd2765a31f71d14c10988722b9537

commit_message:
Add redelegation columns to Trust SQL model

As `extra` column is not a good place to store firmly structured data
we need to move `redelegated_trust_id` and `redelegation_count`
to corresponding columns in the Trust model.

subject: Fix conflict with neutron fact set
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-14 19:19:44.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/tempest_resources.yml'], 'message': "Fix conflict with neutron fact set

I128781dfad54a9543dac79c2406f1e6808816025 has a conflict with
I7fb1f83029ae3176895027a65f1e3cbe803caf7a in how it uses the ternary
check. Ansible fails to default the ternary due to the dict being
undefined. Due to this we will have to revert to the previously
used non-ternary method for Neutron until the upstream module
can be used again.

http://logs.openstack.org/79/396279/13/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/478e23f/console.html#_2016-11-14_16_10_09_202146

Also note If601c321599ac513824df831774c85cef6b8b9bb attempted to
fix this issue, however it fails to resolve this due to the task
being skipped instead of setting tempest_neutron_public_network_id
to '':
http://logs.openstack.org/79/396279/13/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/728804e/console.html#_2016-11-14_19_16_12_755597

Change-Id: I4cc57cfda3214a2103e809ee0cddb9ba7eb4e7ef
"}]
commit_message:
Fix conflict with neutron fact set

I128781dfad54a9543dac79c2406f1e6808816025 has a conflict with
I7fb1f83029ae3176895027a65f1e3cbe803caf7a in how it uses the ternary
check. Ansible fails to default the ternary due to the dict being
undefined. Due to this we will have to revert to the previously
used non-ternary method for Neutron until the upstream module
can be used again.

http://logs.openstack.org/79/396279/13/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/478e23f/console.html#_2016-11-14_16_10_09_202146

Also note If601c321599ac513824df831774c85cef6b8b9bb attempted to
fix this issue, however it fails to resolve this due to the task
being skipped instead of setting tempest_neutron_public_network_id
to '':
http://logs.openstack.org/79/396279/13/check/gate-openstack-ansible-os_monasca-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial/728804e/console.html#_2016-11-14_19_16_12_755597

Change-Id: I4cc57cfda3214a2103e809ee0cddb9ba7eb4e7ef

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-22 06:42:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': 'Return BadRequest for 4 byte unicode characters

Various create apis are returning 500 error when you pass 4
byte unicode characters in the request.

This patch fixes the issue to return HTTP 400 Bad Request.
1. openstack endpoint create
2. openstack role create
3. openstack user create
4. openstack tenant create

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1545736
Change-Id: I4e6a46a83ef5ab367c1bb645db5c2651f5aeeef7
'}]
commit_message:
Return BadRequest for 4 byte unicode characters

Various create apis are returning 500 error when you pass 4
byte unicode characters in the request.

This patch fixes the issue to return HTTP 400 Bad Request.
1. openstack endpoint create
2. openstack role create
3. openstack user create
4. openstack tenant create

APIImpact: For all of the above APIs, it will return 400 error instead
of 500 if user passes 4 byte unicode characters in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1545736
Change-Id: I4e6a46a83ef5ab367c1bb645db5c2651f5aeeef7

subject: Fixes missing OVS Firewall config with OpenDaylight
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 14:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/opendaylight-ovs.yaml'], 'message': 'Fixes missing OVS Firewall config with OpenDaylight

Currently OVS tunnel firewall rules are held within the neutron ovs
agent service heat template.  That service is not used with ODL, so
consequently ODL was missing the VXLAN and GRE firewall rules and
traffic would not pass between nodes.  This adds the missing rules to
the OpenDaylight OVS service.

Closes-Bug: 1641191

Change-Id: Icfd7db6a3e8fcdd02646fb7e413f40f26b03b994
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a5cec52a6c07ce3940431be34dcc45bced5ade04)

commit_message:
Fixes missing OVS Firewall config with OpenDaylight

Currently OVS tunnel firewall rules are held within the neutron ovs
agent service heat template.  That service is not used with ODL, so
consequently ODL was missing the VXLAN and GRE firewall rules and
traffic would not pass between nodes.  This adds the missing rules to
the OpenDaylight OVS service.

Closes-Bug: 1641191

Change-Id: Icfd7db6a3e8fcdd02646fb7e413f40f26b03b994
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a5cec52a6c07ce3940431be34dcc45bced5ade04)

commit_message:
Provide user friendly messages for db_sync

keystone-manage db_sync prints stacktrace if invalid
value for 'version' is passed.

This patch validates 'version' for its type and maximum possible
version present in the repository.Raises DbMigrationError when
greater value is passed for version and displays a meaningful
error message to the user.

Handles DbMigrationError when database schema file is not
present in migration repository and when you pass version
less than current version.

Depends-On: I28533bedba358281ce302b9b021744387a76c04a
Closes-Bug: #1546441
Change-Id: Ibdb045b1169ffdfdd989c6d0f73626daf2f91023

commit_message:
Build jsonhome relationships automatically

Currently when creating routes and registering routes you have to
provide a bunch of jsonhome specific information. Clean this all up so
that you only have to provide the relation name and if relevant the
extension information to declare jsonhome resources.

Change-Id: I4d71b495b8c0a03990cc03830321ba7da599d02d

subject: add Tempest Plugin for functional tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 8859, 'name': 'Daisuke Morita', 'email': 'morita.daisuke@ntti3.com', 'username': 'morrisson'}, {'_account_id': 9576, 'name': 'Thai Tran', 'email': 'tqtran@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tqtran'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17716, 'name': 'Luz Cazares', 'email': 'luz.cazares@intel.com', 'username': 'luzcazares'}, {'_account_id': 18334, 'name': 'Nandini Tata', 'email': 'nandini.tata@intel.com', 'username': 'ntata'}, {'_account_id': 20508, 'name': 'Mohit Motiani', 'email': 'mohit.motiani@intel.com', 'username': 'mohit.motiani'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-11 13:52:38.000000000', 'files': ['test/tempest/__init__.py', 'test/tempest/plugin.py', 'test/tempest/README.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "add Tempest Plugin for functional tests

This is an in-repo tempest plugin i.e. the plugin resides inside the swift repo
and requires to install swift inorder to install the plugin.

Directory Structre:
The tempest plugin that resides at swift/test/tempest/ uses a symbolic link
to functional tests that reside at swift/test/functional. By this, we eliminate
the possibility of probe and unit tests also get discovered when the top level
diretory of the tests i.e. swift/test is passed to test_discovery module.
Further, we keep the path to Swift's functional tests intact and let them be
invoked normally using testr from the swift root diretory.

Alternatively, we can move the functional tests to under the tempest test to
avoid creation of symlink. In this case, we have to update the import paths of
all the functional tests and their path in testr config.

Current implementation does not include any additional configurations for
enabling tempest to invoke and successfully run Swift's functional tests. If
there is a need to add more config options apart from what is offered in
tempest.conf, we need to create a config.py under swift/test/tempest and pass
its object to the functional tests. Currently, the user credentials for running
functional tests are picked up from /etc/swift/test.conf

Change-Id: I2af9cdc010311d25a7b9a1464f4a4466d86b6c7c
Closes-bug: #1571088
"}]
commit_message:
add Tempest Plugin for functional tests

This is an in-repo tempest plugin i.e. the plugin resides inside the swift repo
and requires to install swift inorder to install the plugin.

Directory Structre:
The tempest plugin that resides at swift/test/tempest/ uses a symbolic link
to functional tests that reside at swift/test/functional. By this, we eliminate
the possibility of probe and unit tests also get discovered when the top level
diretory of the tests i.e. swift/test is passed to test_discovery module.
Further, we keep the path to Swift's functional tests intact and let them be
invoked normally using testr from the swift root diretory.

Alternatively, we can move the functional tests to under the tempest test to
avoid creation of symlink. In this case, we have to update the import paths of
all the functional tests and their path in testr config.

Current implementation does not include any additional configurations for
enabling tempest to invoke and successfully run Swift's functional tests. If
there is a need to add more config options apart from what is offered in
tempest.conf, we need to create a config.py under swift/test/tempest and pass
its object to the functional tests. Currently, the user credentials for running
functional tests are picked up from /etc/swift/test.conf

Change-Id: I2af9cdc010311d25a7b9a1464f4a4466d86b6c7c
Closes-bug: #1571088

commit_message:
Removed conflict wrapper on delete_project

Since the wrapper checks for intergrity error
and duplicate entry error and it is impossible
to get these errors while deleting a project.

Closes-Bug: #1410029

commit_message:
For setup_ssh create intermediate directories as 0755

When doing setup_ssh, if we create any intermediate directories,
create them with permission of 0755. The final directory will still
have a permission of 0700.

This can help if creating a directory path that doesn't yet exist
including some of the parent directories.

Change-Id: I86b9c70004988a494359c9b78c8acec25c5beed8

commit_message:
Ceph bits for live-migration job

This change re-enables ceph for glance and nova
ephemeral disks.

subject: Create dummy overcloud-full in --boostrap-subnodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 18:34:14.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh', 'scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Create dummy overcloud-full in --boostrap-subnodes

Moves the creation of the dummy overcloud-full image from deploy.sh into
tripleo.sh. As this step has to be performed when using multinode setups
for dev/test, it makes more sense to be in tripleo.sh for re-usability.

The dummy image is needed because there is no way to disable the image
constraint in tripleo-heat-templates when using multinode setups without
removing the constraint entirely (which we may eventually need to do).

It's added to the --boostrap-subnodes option as it reasons that if you
are bootstrapping subnodes, you likely need a dummy image in glance. If
a real image already exists, then this step is skipped.

Change-Id: I9d40e717a6f85bbab39a25d361987a17d0527ecb
"}]
commit_message:
Create dummy overcloud-full in --boostrap-subnodes

Moves the creation of the dummy overcloud-full image from deploy.sh into
tripleo.sh. As this step has to be performed when using multinode setups
for dev/test, it makes more sense to be in tripleo.sh for re-usability.

The dummy image is needed because there is no way to disable the image
constraint in tripleo-heat-templates when using multinode setups without
removing the constraint entirely (which we may eventually need to do).

It's added to the --boostrap-subnodes option as it reasons that if you
are bootstrapping subnodes, you likely need a dummy image in glance. If
a real image already exists, then this step is skipped.

Change-Id: I9d40e717a6f85bbab39a25d361987a17d0527ecb

commit_message:
Log OVS IDL library errors to neutron logs

The OVS IDL library, instead of passing exceptions, logs them
via its Vlog wrapper around Python's logging module. Currently,
we aren't getting any of these log messages. This patch replaces
the Vlog class log methods with the equivalent oslo_log methods.

Closes-Bug: #1634258
Change-Id: Id5a55b5fc323641d0dfd6e3e78b2d2422482fbe0

commit_message:
Do not throw an exception if stack outputs is not set

In some rare cases, stack output is not set and this line throws
an exception. This causes stack deletion to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1638741

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-11 23:18:09.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/tests/test_collect.py', 'os_collect_config/ec2.py', 'os_collect_config/tests/test_ec2.py'], 'message': 'Treat ec2 collector data as immutable

Currently the ec2 collector polls the nova metadata service every
$polling_period even though the data is not expected to change and no
known config actions have been written to respond to changes in these
values.

With larger overclouds, this metadata polling will cause noticeable
load on the undercloud, especially nova-api and neutron (for port
lookups).

This change will check for data in /var/lib/os-collect-config/ec2.json
and simply return that if it exists.

Change-Id: I84156f8b005b319fccf8ac17af8943aefb0a8f6d
Closes-Bug: #1619072
'}]
commit_message:
Treat ec2 collector data as immutable

Currently the ec2 collector polls the nova metadata service every
$polling_period even though the data is not expected to change and no
known config actions have been written to respond to changes in these
values.

With larger overclouds, this metadata polling will cause noticeable
load on the undercloud, especially nova-api and neutron (for port
lookups).

This change will check for data in /var/lib/os-collect-config/ec2.json
and simply return that if it exists.

Change-Id: I84156f8b005b319fccf8ac17af8943aefb0a8f6d
Closes-Bug: #1619072

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 12:37:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_disable_smt.yml'], 'message': 'Do not configure smt disabling init scripts always

The error "Machine is not SMT capable" is seen on VMs which
are of ppc64le architecture. So the init script/conf should

Closes-Bug: #1640733
'}]
commit_message:
Do not configure smt disabling init scripts always

The error "Machine is not SMT capable" is seen on VMs which
are of ppc64le architecture. So the init script/conf should
be configured only when disabling SMT task succeeds.

Change-Id: I399b523a2b7e271b8ebf225299c81cb166321118
Closes-Bug: #1640733

subject: Add pathlib2 to requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-12 19:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add pathlib2 to requirements

As stated on the pathlib website that package is no longer
maintained and since pathlib is now in the std lib it is
appropriate to have a backport of that std lib version for
general usage in version of python that are older 3.4

This library provides that backport so that projects can
use the newer libraries features and more easily transtion
to the native python 3.4 (and newer) version when they are
able.

Link: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pathlib2

Is the library actively maintained?

It is a backport that seems to be updated recently.

Is the library good code?

Just a backport so only really as good as the one built
into python itself.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

Is the library license compatible?

Yes.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Seems to already be in ubuntu, unsure if its fedora.

Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

Nope.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup?

I plan on transitioning kolla to using it (other projects
that do path routines or things with os.walk or os.path should
likely also move to it).

Change-Id: Id1dfaf38fcc511d438763bcc52a55c3f6bf6f4c1
'}]
commit_message:
Add pathlib2 to requirements

As stated on the pathlib website that package is no longer
maintained and since pathlib is now in the std lib it is
appropriate to have a backport of that std lib version for
general usage in version of python that are older 3.4

This library provides that backport so that projects can
use the newer libraries features and more easily transtion
to the native python 3.4 (and newer) version when they are
able.

Link: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pathlib2

Is the library actively maintained?

It is a backport that seems to be updated recently.

Is the library good code?

Just a backport so only really as good as the one built
into python itself.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

Is the library license compatible?

Yes.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

Seems to already be in ubuntu, unsure if its fedora.

Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

Nope.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup?

I plan on transitioning kolla to using it (other projects
that do path routines or things with os.walk or os.path should
likely also move to it).

Change-Id: Id1dfaf38fcc511d438763bcc52a55c3f6bf6f4c1

OSC add capability to remove node/chassis_uuid

Allow to unset the field chassis_uuid from a node using the
'openstack baremetal node unset --chassis-uuid <node_uuid>'
command.
Bump last known API version to 1.25

Related-Bug: #1563263

commit_message:
Rename tmpfiles.d files

On CentOS /run/lock is created by /usr/lib/tmpfiles.d/legacy.conf file
which can be run after other conf we create for opentack services.
This patch rename the service files to openstack-service.conf to ensure
it is ran after legacy.conf

Change-Id: I3ff9bd09b639acdd77df6d7e48c7389c6f6f085d

commit_message:
Install gating repo when you have undercloud

Sometimes undercloud-ready machine that wasn't done from prepared
image and it will require installation of gating repo packages.
Also if there is images of overcloud it will update it too.
Essential for TripleO CI when we get virtual machines from
nodepool.

Change-Id: Ib217a0ab6f44e69dbaa2652149c7e3240422c974

commit_message:
Only store neutron facts if neutron is enabled

The neutron_networks variable won't exist if neutron isn't enabled for
tempest. This causes issues for services (such as ceilometer) that don't
use tempest with neutron.

Change-Id: If601c321599ac513824df831774c85cef6b8b9bb

When the configured repos require yum priorities to be respected
(such as our delorean setup for CI), this is required.  For setups
that don't need priorities, it won't hurt anything to have it
installed.

This allows us to get rid of a bad hack in tripleo.sh:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/scripts/tripleo.sh#L328

Note that the delorean-repo element already installs this too, but
in CI we aren't using that element because we pass in repo files
directly using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF.

Change-Id: I3da511f369b76ff9ea84097c9b2b4d54a6997305
"}]
commit_message:
Always install yum-plugin-priorities

When the configured repos require yum priorities to be respected
(such as our delorean setup for CI), this is required.  For setups
that don't need priorities, it won't hurt anything to have it
installed.

This allows us to get rid of a bad hack in tripleo.sh:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/scripts/tripleo.sh#L328

Note that the delorean-repo element already installs this too, but
in CI we aren't using that element because we pass in repo files
directly using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF.

Change-Id: I3da511f369b76ff9ea84097c9b2b4d54a6997305

commit_message:
Switch overcloud build images to use ImageBuildManager

Add support to overcloud build images to utilize ImageBuildManager.
The interface adds a '--config-file', and moves the old commands into
a group to make it clear that they are deprecated and will not work in
the future.

Change-Id: I69d9b132890dcdb598f560f03e19254534a1c1ae

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-10 23:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_cells.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Transform requested secgroup names to uuids

We currently don't store requested security groups with the instance
(or build request) when using neutron, but we plan on doing that as
part of the cells v2 scheduling interaction and moving the instance
create to conductor. The plan is to store the SecurityGroupList
in the request spec so we can lookup the requested security groups
again later.

In order to avoid a situation where the name changes on a security
group in neutron, we need to store the uuid which is immutable. So
this change transforms any requested security group names to uuids
when using neutron as if the user had only requested uuids.

Nothing is using this yet as populate_security_groups in the
neutron security group driver is basically a no-op, but later
changes will rely on this when storing the security groups in the
request spec.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I1964ee3a7529bb3a1facd38ee62a71c148ecaef1
"}]
commit_message:
Transform requested secgroup names to uuids

We currently don't store requested security groups with the instance
(or build request) when using neutron, but we plan on doing that as
part of the cells v2 scheduling interaction and moving the instance
create to conductor. The plan is to store the SecurityGroupList
in the request spec so we can lookup the requested security groups
again later.

In order to avoid a situation where the name changes on a security
group in neutron, we need to store the uuid which is immutable. So
this change transforms any requested security group names to uuids
when using neutron as if the user had only requested uuids.

Nothing is using this yet as populate_security_groups in the
neutron security group driver is basically a no-op, but later
changes will rely on this when storing the security groups in the
request spec.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I1964ee3a7529bb3a1facd38ee62a71c148ecaef1

commit_message:
Avoid disabling rhel-7-server-rh-common-rpms

while using disk-image-builder for building overcloud images for TripleO
using RDO, this repository is (in my opinion) wrongly disabled because
contains certain dependencies needed by RDO packages.
Example: python-cheetah is required for python-nova, but is not
available through RDO repository but only from
rhel-7-server-rh-common-rpms

Closes-Bug: #1638938
Change-Id: I76824c8ec02590397f1ff1d4f177ad061c7bf441
Signed-off-by: Luca Lorenzetto <lorenzetto.luca@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove deprecated manager classes in service.py

Below options in DEFAULT section which were deprecated in
Mitaka has been completely removed.
      * console_manager
      * consoleauth_manager
      * cert_manager
      * scheduler_manager

Also added constants for service manager classes so that tests
can call them directly instead of remembering the class names.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: Idc049b455a7df483556cfba0c34d5fcfb3deb3ec

commit_message:
Add elements for Cassandra 2.2/3.0

Also remove unneccessary paskages and
install Java 8 to work around a known issue
in the Cassandra's service script which
prevents it from starting up when using
a Java revision > 99 (CASSANDRA-11661).
